intro: Eriodictyon trichocalyx var. lanatum, commonly known as California licorice, is a perennial shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of white to pale purple flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland chaparral habitats. Its aromatic leaves and roots have been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for medicinal purposes.
